title: Self-Portrait

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pen and black ink on cream laid paper.

description: Beckmann's 1917 self-portrait reflects his despair during the later war years. According to the inscription he added in the upper-right corner, this brooding image was drawn at four o'clock in the morning. The artist's deep-set, blankly staring eyes are strangely quiet and contemplative compared to his quivering handling of the medium.
medium_display: Pen and black ink on cream laid paper
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Allan Frumkin
publication_history:
Stephan von Weise, Max Beckmann’s zeichnerisches Werk 1903-1925 (Dusseldorf, 1978), pp. 110, 121 and 211, no. 368.

Fritz Erpel, Max Beckmann: Leben im Werk, Die Selbstbildnisse (Berlin, 1985), no. 60 (ill.).

Peter Selz, Max Beckmann (New York, 1992), p. 26 and 116 (ill.).

Sandy Brooke, Hooked on Drawing (Englewood Cliffs, NJ, 1996), p. 258 (ill.).

Sandy Brooke, Drawings as Expression, Concepts and Techniques (2001).

Allan Frumkin, Masterpieces (2002).

Knut Soiné, 'Christ Beckmann? On Max Beckmanns "Self-Portrait with the Red Scarf", 1917', Jahrbuch der staatlichen Kunstsalunen Baden-Württemberg (2002).
exhibition_history:
Bielefeld, Germany, Kunsthalle Bielefeld, "Max Beckmann: Aquarelle und Zeichnungen 1903 bis 1950," October 16-December 11, 1977, cat. 71; traveled to Germany, the Kunsthalle Tübingen, January 7-February 26, 1978; and Frankfurt am Main, the Städtische Galerie im Städelschen Kunstinstitut, March 18-May 21, 1978. 

Frankfurt am Main, Städtische Galerie im Städelschen Kunstinstitut, "Max Beckmann Frankfurt 1915-1933," November 19, 1983-February 12, 1984, cat. 107.

Munich, Haus der Kunst, "Max Beckmann Retropsective," 1984, cat. 151, cat. by Carla Schulz-Hoffmann, Judith C. Weiss, et. al.; traveled to the Nationalgaleire, Berlin, the St. Louis Art Museum, and the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Great Drawings from The Art Institute of Chicago: The Harold Joachim Years 1958-1983," July 24-September 30, 1985, pp. 188-189, cat. 87 (ill.), cat. by Martha Tedeschi; traveled to the St. Louis Art Museum, March 10-May 16, 1986.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Reflections of Weimer Germany: Portfolios by Max Beckmann and Lovis Corinth," July 18-October 31, 1992.

 Paris, Musée National d'Art Moderne, Centre Pompidou, "Rétrospective Max Beckmann;" traveled to New York, the Museum of Modern Art, June 25-September 30, 2003.
provenance_text: Sold by J. B. Neumann to Allan Frumkin, New York and Chicago, 1950s [a letter from Allan Frumkin of October 9, 2002 in curatorial file]; given by Mr. and Mrs. Allan Frumkin to the Art Institute, 1975.
